issues.description: The textual description in Part 2 of the problem statement requires messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) (i.e., a method with a double parameter and a return string including the volume). However, the UML in the problem statement, the template usage (Main.java), and the solution all define/use messageOnMilk() with no parameters. This is a parameter/signature mismatch: students following the textual instruction would implement a method with a double parameter, which will not match the provided interfaces, template calls, or tests and will cause compilation/test failures or confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement text with the UML, template, and solution. Either (A) update the Part 2 textual description to require messageOnMilk() with no parameters and show the example return string without volume (e.g. "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"), or (B) if the volume parameter is the intended exercise, update the interface signature to messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and change all implementations (Milkable, Goat, Seal, any calls in Main and tests) to accept the double parameter and include the volume in the returned string. The least disruptive fix is option (A): correct the textual instructions to specify the no-argument messageOnMilk() so they match UML, template, and tests.

issues.description: The problem description (Part 2) requires a milk method with a double parameter: messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and expects a return string including the volume ("[Animal Type] [name] is milked (volume: [milkVolume]L)"). However, the UML in the same problem statement, the template usage, and the provided solution all define/use messageOnMilk() with no parameter and return a string without a volume. This mismatch in the method signature and expected output creates a clear mapping conflict: students following the textual instructions will attempt to implement/override a different method signature than the template/solution and the tests expect, leading to compile errors or failing tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the specification across artifacts. Either (A) update the problem text to match the UML/template/solution by specifying messageOnMilk() with no parameters and example return value "[Animal Type] [name] is milked", or (B) update the template and solution to use messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) everywhere (change the Milkable interface, update all implementations to accept the parameter and include the volume in the returned string, and update Main/test usage). Option A is the least disruptive and is recommended if tests expect the no-argument version.
